alert.note: Alert for Fallon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:48PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Fallon County through 645 PM MDT... At 547 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Marmarth, or 18 miles southeast of Baker, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Stay alert for ponding of water on roads. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Fallon County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
